title: Bloomsbury pinning hopes on releases such as illustrated Harry Potter book to boost Christmas sales
text:
Publisher Bloomsbury is pinning its hopes on new releases such as an illustrated Harry Potter book and a healthy lifestyle offering from chef Tom Kerridge to boost sales this Christmas.

Half-year profits fell 19 per cent to £1.3m in the six months to August 31 after a 5 per cent slide in revenues to £71.3m.

Best-seller?: The illustrated edition of Harry Potter and the Goblet Of Fire (inset) by JK Rowling and Jim Kay

But Bloomsbury has ten titles it claims are recent, current or potential best-sellers.

These include an illustrated edition of Harry Potter and the Goblet Of Fire by JK Rowling and Jim Kay as well as Michelin-starred chef Tom Kerridge's new title in December, called Lose Weight And Get Fit.

The boy wizard's books show no sign of waning – the paperback edition of Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone was the eighth best-selling children's book of the year to date, 22 years after it was published.
